title: The money well is running dry at BP
teaser: The company's $20 billion Gulf oil spill compensation fund is almost empty -- and there could be many more claims in the pipeline.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, July 30, 2013
contentencoded:
London-based oil giant BP is being drained by legal claims, after the oil spill in the Gulf three years ago. The company's $20 billion compensation fund is almost empty -- and there could be many more claims in the pipeline.

Marketplace's Stephen Beard joins Morning Report host David Brancaccio to discuss.
